required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Modified AutoSet Device vs Existing AutoSet Device, the Assessment of Efficacy and Subjective Comfort of the Treatment.
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Efficacy and Subjective Comfort of a Modified AutoSet Device With an Existing AutoSet Device (VPAP Auto) in Treating Obstructive Sleep Apnea

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the performance of the modified AutoSet device is equivalent or better than the existing AutoSet device (VPAP Auto) in the efficacy of the treatment and the subjective comfort.

detailed_description.textblock: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is characterised by a partial or complete collapse of the upper airway during sleep. The treatment of choice for OSA is Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP). CPAP acts as a positive airway splint, delivering a fixed or auto adjusted positive pressure to the upper airway via a tube and mask. The modified device to be assessed in this study will act in a similar way to the existing device, VPAP Auto, but utilizes an improved algorithm which should maintain or enhance the effectiveness of the treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: One Night On Each Arm, approximately 8 hours each night
primary_outcome.description: The number of apneas and hypopnoeas per hour of sleep measured on Nexus Auto & VPAP Auto 25

primary_outcome.time_frame: One Night On Each Arm, approximately 8 hours each night
primary_outcome.description: Number of oxygen desaturations per hour of sleep

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One Night On Each Arm, approximately 8 hours each night
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's Comfort Rating in one question: How comfortable/uncomfortable was the CPAP device to breathe on? Ratings from 0 (very uncomfortable) to 10 (very comfortable) on a Likert Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One Night On Each Arm, approximately 8 hours each night
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's treatment satisfaction in one question: How much did the CPAP disturb your sleep last night? Rating from 0 (a lot) to 10 (not at all) on a Likert Scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One Night On Each Arm, approximately 8 hours each night
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated 0 (not refreshed at all) to 10 (very refreshed) on Likert Scale on one question: How refreshed did you feel this morning?

arm_group.description: Participants were randomised to Nexus Flow Generator group for one night.
Participants were randomised to VPAP Flow Generator 25 group for one night.

intervention.description: The modified device to be assessed in this study will act in a similar way to the existing device, VPAP Auto, but utilises an improved algorithm which should maintain or enhance the effectiveness of the treatment.
Exiting VPAP Auto 25 Flow Generator with A10 Algorithm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged 18-80 years
- Patients who are on CPAP therapy in AUTOSET mode for no less than 6 months
- Patients who are using ResMed masks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are unable to provide written informed consent
- Patients who are unable to comprehend written and spoken English
- Patients who are using Bilevel PAP
- Patients who are pregnant
- Patients who are suffering any of the following:
- Acute respiratory infection
- Acute sinusitis, otitis media or perforated eardrum
- Pneumothorax or pneumomediastinum
- Recent history of severe epistaxis requiring medical attention

overall_official.affiliation: ResMed/The University of New South Wales

group.title: Modified Autoset (Nexus Flow Generator)
group.description: AutoSet algorithms measure breathing patterns and respond to increase or decresase pressures to overcome obstructive sleep apnea. The modified AutoSet algorithm contains software updates to better measure and respond to sleep apnea. Participants used this device for one night, followed by the standard AutoSet, in a randomised order

group.title: VPAP Flow Generator 25
group.description: Existing AutoSet algorithm for the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea. Participants used this device for one night, followed by the modified AutoSet algorithm, in a randomised order

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: This was a cross-over study, therefore all participants were assigned to both interventions, for one night each, in a randomised order

outcome.title: Apnoea-Hypopnoea Index (AHI)
outcome.description: The number of apneas and hypopnoeas per hour of sleep measured on Nexus Auto & VPAP Auto 25
outcome.time_frame: One Night On Each Arm, approximately 8 hours each night
outcome.population: Participants included in the study were those who were on CPAP therapy for no less than 6 months and were on auto adjustment mode.

group.title: Nexus Flow Generator
group.description: Participants were randomised to Nexus Flow Generator with modified auto set algorithm group for one night.

group.title: VPAP Flow Generator 25
group.description: Participants were randomised to VPAP Flow Generator Auto 25 with A10 algorithm group for one night.

group.title: Nexus Flow Generator
group.description: Modified AutoSet for the treatment of OSA. Participants used this device while sleeping for one night. No Adverse Events were reported during the trial

group.title: VPAP Flow Generator 25
group.description: Standard AutoSet for the treatment of OSA. Participants used this device while sleeping for one night. No adverse events were reported during the trial

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
